problems.prompt: Design a buck converter for automotive 12V→5V, 3A with: <1% output ripple, >92% efficiency, <100kHz EMI compliance, -40°C to 85°C operation. Specify all component values and justify selections.
Design a boost converter for solar battery charger: 12-18V panel to 24V battery, 100W. Must handle MPPT tracking with <0.5% tracking error and provide input current limiting at 7A.
Design a flyback for isolated 48V→5V/10A auxiliary supply with: 5000V isolation, <50mV ripple, creepage >8mm. Include transformer design with specific core selection.
Design a full-bridge converter for 48V to ±15V dual output, 200W total (symmetric loads). Both outputs must track within 1% and share a single transformer.
Design a SEPIC for wide-input LED driver: 9-36V DC input to constant 700mA output (LED forward voltage 24-32V depending on temp). Implement constant current control.
Design a buck converter optimized for 10%-100% load efficiency: 24V→5V, 0.5-5A. Achieve >85% efficiency at 10% load and >93% at full load. Consider PFM/PWM mode switching.
Design a boost converter for portable device: 3.0-4.2V (1S Li-ion) to 5V, 2A max. Optimize for <1mA quiescent current at no load while maintaining regulation.
Design a buck converter with fast transient response: 12V→1.8V, 0-20A load step. Must recover to within 3% in <50µs. Calculate output capacitance and control bandwidth.
Design a boost converter with input voltage transient immunity: 4.5-5.5V input, 12V output, 3A. Must maintain output within 5% during 1V/µs input slew rate.
Design a buck converter fitting in 10x10mm: 5V→3.3V, 2A. Minimize total inductor+capacitor volume while meeting 20mV ripple spec. Switching frequency is your optimization variable.
